body:
Your analysis looks good!

Probably what should happen is that here

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/cff85f0b9551881be535a4847b56742451e6b476/cmd/cmd.go#L445

The error should be unwrapped then `resolveExitCode` called recursively.

Fancy sending in a pull request?
Will do shortly. I guess it should be for the whole switch-case or only for the fatal error case?

> Will do shortly. I guess it should be for the whole switch-case or only for the fatal error case?

I was thinking only for the fatal error case, though maybe the Retry/NoRetry cases should be treated the same... Probably what we want to do is attempt to unwrap the fatal error, and if it isn't anything special exit with `exitCodeFatalError` which is a bit more complicated.
Any news on this ? It could be really usefull to check on the exit code nÂ°8 in a script to sleep 24h before attempting a "rclone sync" again.
@kadafax would you like to work on a fix? I don't think it should be too complicated (but I could be wrong!)
Just checked out first commit, interesting

Nick, can you help me,

Cant understand why [_, unwrapped := fserrors.Cause(err)](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/cff85f0b9551881be535a4847b56742451e6b476/cmd/cmd.go#L429) cant unwrap down to **accounting.ErrorMaxTransferLimitReached** and match it few lines below.

> Nick, can you help me,
> 
> Cant understand why [_, unwrapped := fserrors.Cause(err)](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/cff85f0b9551881be535a4847b56742451e6b476/cmd/cmd.go#L429) cant unwrap down to **accounting.ErrorMaxTransferLimitReached** and match it few lines below.

Not sure...

I'd put a `fmt.Printf("err = %#v\n", err)` in there to find out what kind of error it really is.

Thanks Nick,

This what I found
unwrapped err = Max transfer limit reached as set by --max-transfer, type = *errors.fundamental

and of course it doesn't match to accounting.ErrorMaxTransferLimitReached.

Maybe switch to err.Unwrap(), instead of err.Cause() method and use new errors.Is(err, accounting.ErrorMaxTransferLimitReached) func from stdlib.

Or make custom errors.Is(err, targeterr error) in lib/errors/errors.go.

issue.title: Correct exitcode on Transfer Limit Exceeded flag. Fixes #3203

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Send correct exit code(8) when transfer is limited by --max-transfer flag.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Issue #3203

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
Nick please, check also my last comment.

Now I see we should comply with go 1.11 and 1.12, so in this case i think we should implement our own errors.Is().

I see...

The definition is

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/ce23cb209313d870141b1c062f7c2a3bc8cf7f3e/fs/accounting/accounting.go#L21

Perhaps we should split that up into

```go
var ErrorMaxTransferLimitReached = errors.New("Max transfer limit reached as set by --max-transfer")
var ErrorMaxTransferLimitReachedFatal = fserrors.FatalError(ErrorMaxTransferLimitReached)
```

And check for `ErrorMaxTransferLimitReached` but return `ErrorMaxTransferLimitReachedFatal`

Thanks you for your comments, your solution looks more natural

New commit ready.
